***Hello, I'm Carter.***

I am an MA candidate in Cognitive Psychology at the [University of Waterloo](https://uwaterloo.ca/psychology/), where I study in Dr. Clara Colombatto's [Vision and Cognition Laboratory.](https://colombattolab.com/)

My current research examines the low-level cues that humans observe in social interactions (e.g., velocity of others' movements) which may allow for higher-level inferences about others' mental states (e.g., intentions). Further, I explore how these cues may influence an observersâ€™ cognition (e.g., their attention).

In the past, I have [studied](research/smith-et-al-2026-DST/index.qmd) the auditory conditions *misophonia* and *hyperacusis* and their association with depression and anxiety. I have also [worked](research/smith-scheerer-2025-thesis/index.qmd) with virtual reality to explore how modifying stimulus properties (e.g., slot machine size) alters gambling behaviours.

I am passionate about philosophy, cycling, music, and the Toronto Blue Jays.

Please feel free to contact me at: [carter.smith@uwaterloo.ca](mailto:carter.smith@uwaterloo.ca).
